I feel like this is the game that really accelerated the PC gaming world out of the repetitive gameplay, trashy graphics, copied story style games that so many devs were throwing out to see what stuck. Like when you think Steam, this is one of the first games that comes to mind. Something that everyone has and can bond over. I don't have many friends, but the few that I do have all own this game!
i played this game in several chunks, and eventually played it all the way through, the ending escape sequence and final fight made that all worth it.

Not much to say here, as everything has already been said, but the atmosphere this game creates is just amazing. The soundtrack complements the game very well, and the gameplay is still great to this day. There isn't much replayability to the game, but those one or two playthroughs are definitely worth the $10 price tag. Plus, the game is $2 on sale. Many consider this to be one of the best games ever made, and I wholeheartedly agree.

Portal is simply one of the best games ever made with an excellent successor and story that lingers in the background waiting to be told. the gameplay is straightforward, the puzzles are great. and it became a yearly tradition for me to play ever since the game came out. (not always legally unfortunatly) it was a game ahead of it's time.

8/10 - Obviously Portal 1 is not as good as Portal 2, however there is still many reasons why this game itself amazing. Firstly, Portal 1 is the original Portal game, besides the aztec-style concept game that inspired Portal, and Portal 2 uses the concepts, game mechanics and world from Portal 1. Portal also has a unique energy ball mechanic not used in Portal 2, mandatory portal bumping (if getting all achievements), 19 different and unique chambers + the escape level, a commentary mode you can play that gives you insight on the different game production decisions that were made and why, an advanced chamber mode consisting of 6 modified chambers, an insanely difficult challenge chamber mode for 6 of the already existing chambers, a lot of lore including Ratman and the infamous 'the cake is a lie' meme. Getting all 15 achievements for this game was EXTREMELY difficult due to the challenge mode achievements, but I eventually got there. If you enjoyed Portal 2 and/or are interested in playing a legendary 1st person 3D puzzle game, then you should definitely play Portal 1. However only attempt getting all the achievements if you're willing to spend the time, follow many tutorials, are patient enough to not punch your monitor and are a completionist. I didn't enjoy Portal 1 as much as Portal 2, however it is still a legendary game.
